00071 BL_ShapeDeformer::BL_ShapeDeformer(BL_DeformableGameObject *gameobj,
00072                                    Object *bmeshobj,
00073                                    RAS_MeshObject *mesh)
00074     :
00075       BL_SkinDeformer(gameobj,bmeshobj, mesh),
00076       m_useShapeDrivers(false),
00077       m_lastShapeUpdate(-1)
00078 {
00079     m_key = m_bmesh->key;
00080     m_bmesh->key = copy_key(m_key);
00081 };
00082 
00083 /* this second constructor is needed for making a mesh deformable on the fly. */
00084 BL_ShapeDeformer::BL_ShapeDeformer(BL_DeformableGameObject *gameobj,
00085                 Object *bmeshobj_old,
00086                 Object *bmeshobj_new,
00087                 RAS_MeshObject *mesh,
00088                 bool release_object,
00089                 bool recalc_normal,
00090                 BL_ArmatureObject* arma)
00091                 :
00092                     BL_SkinDeformer(gameobj, bmeshobj_old, bmeshobj_new, mesh, release_object, recalc_normal, arma),
00093                     m_useShapeDrivers(false),
00094                     m_lastShapeUpdate(-1)
00095 {
00096     m_key = m_bmesh->key;
00097     m_bmesh->key = copy_key(m_key);
00098 };
00099 
00100 BL_ShapeDeformer::~BL_ShapeDeformer()
00101 {
00102     if (m_key && m_bmesh->key && m_key != m_bmesh->key)
00103     {
00104         free_key(m_bmesh->key);
00105         BLI_remlink_safe(&G.main->key, m_bmesh->key);
00106         MEM_freeN(m_bmesh->key);
00107         m_bmesh->key = m_key;
00108         m_key = NULL;
00109     }
00110 };

00112 RAS_Deformer *BL_ShapeDeformer::GetReplica()
00113 {
00114     BL_ShapeDeformer *result;
00115 
00116     result = new BL_ShapeDeformer(*this);
00117     result->ProcessReplica();
00118     return result;
00119 }
00120 
00121 void BL_ShapeDeformer::ProcessReplica()
00122 {
00123     BL_SkinDeformer::ProcessReplica();
00124     m_lastShapeUpdate = -1;
00125 }
00126 
00127 bool BL_ShapeDeformer::LoadShapeDrivers(Object* arma)
00128 {
00129     // This used to check if we had drivers from this armature,
00130     // now we just assume we want to use shape drivers
00131     // and let the animsys handle things.
00132     m_useShapeDrivers = true;
00133 
00134     return true;
00135 }
00136 
00137 bool BL_ShapeDeformer::ExecuteShapeDrivers(void)
00138 {
00139     if (m_useShapeDrivers && PoseUpdated()) {
00140         // the shape drivers use the bone matrix as input. Must 
00141         // update the matrix now
00142         m_armobj->ApplyPose();
00143 
00144         // We don't need an actual time, just use 0
00145         BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(NULL, &GetKey()->id, GetKey()->adt, 0.f, ADT_RECALC_DRIVERS);
00146 
00147         ForceUpdate();
00148         m_armobj->RestorePose();
00149         m_bDynamic = true;
00150         return true;
00151     }
00152     return false;
00153 }
00154 
00155 bool BL_ShapeDeformer::Update(void)
00156 {
00157     bool bShapeUpdate = false;
00158     bool bSkinUpdate = false;
00159 
00160     ExecuteShapeDrivers();
00161 
00162     /* See if the object shape has changed */
00163     if (m_lastShapeUpdate != m_gameobj->GetLastFrame()) {
00164         /* the key coefficient have been set already, we just need to blend the keys */
00165         Object* blendobj = m_gameobj->GetBlendObject();
00166         
00167         // make sure the vertex weight cache is in line with this object
00168         m_pMeshObject->CheckWeightCache(blendobj);
00169 
00170         /* we will blend the key directly in m_transverts array: it is used by armature as the start position */
00171         /* m_bmesh->key can be NULL in case of Modifier deformer */
00172         if (m_bmesh->key) {
00173             /* store verts locally */
00174             VerifyStorage();
00175 
00176             do_rel_key(0, m_bmesh->totvert, m_bmesh->totvert, (char *)(float *)m_transverts, m_bmesh->key, NULL, 0); /* last arg is ignored */
00177             m_bDynamic = true;
00178         }
00179 
00180         // Don't release the weight array as in Blender, it will most likely be reusable on next frame 
00181         // The weight array are ultimately deleted when the skin mesh is destroyed
00182            
00183         /* Update the current frame */
00184         m_lastShapeUpdate=m_gameobj->GetLastFrame();
00185 
00186         // As we have changed, the mesh, the skin deformer must update as well.
00187         // This will force the update
00188         BL_SkinDeformer::ForceUpdate();
00189         bShapeUpdate = true;
00190     }
00191     // check for armature deform
00192     bSkinUpdate = BL_SkinDeformer::UpdateInternal(bShapeUpdate && m_bDynamic);
00193 
00194     // non dynamic deformer = Modifer without armature and shape keys, no need to create storage
00195     if (!bSkinUpdate && bShapeUpdate && m_bDynamic) {
00196         // this means that there is no armature, we still need to 
00197         // update the normal (was not done after shape key calculation)
00198 
00199 #ifdef __NLA_DEFNORMALS
00200         if (m_recalcNormal)
00201             RecalcNormals();
00202 #endif
00203         bSkinUpdate = true;
00204     }
00205     return bSkinUpdate;
00206 }
00207 
00208 Key *BL_ShapeDeformer::GetKey()
00209 {
00210     return m_bmesh->key;
00211 }
00212 
00213 void BL_ShapeDeformer::SetKey(Key *key)
00214 {
00215     m_bmesh->key = key;
00216 }
